arts.ttl: McTominay and Dykes denied as Scotland earn deserved draw in Denmark
arts.sum: A penny for the thoughts of Christian Eriksen. Denmark could justify leaving the 33-year-old out of their squad for the meetings with Scotland and Greece on the basis he remains unemployed. Yet as Denmark huffed, puffed and failed to unpick a magnificently drilled Scotland defence, the issue of what Eriksen could have contributed was such an obvious one. Denmark in this form will not play at next summer’s World Cup. Steve Clarke’s Scotland were well worthy of their point. But for a lack of composure in front of goal, they would have departed Copenhagen with all three. The winners from this opening night of a truncated section were the Greeks, who swept Belarus aside, but Scotland richly deserved their full-time ovation from an appreciative support, while Denmark were booed off. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Scotland open World Cup qualification bid with draw in Denmark
arts.sum: Scotland opened their World Cup 2026 qualifying campaign with a goalless draw against Denmark in Copenhagen.

arts.ttl: Team’s Up – Uninspiring lineup for Scotland against Denmark as Celtic duo withdraw
arts.sum: Scotland manager Steve Clarke has named his team for this evening’s World Cup qualifier against Denmark in Copenhagen. It is fair to say that it is a somewhat underwhelming team selection from the ex-West Brom manager as Ben Gannon-Doak and Kieron Bowie start from the bench. arts.ttl: Team’s Up – Schmeichel starts for Denmark against Scotland
arts.sum: Celtic goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel has been named in the Denmark Starting XI for this evening’s World Cup qualifier against Scotland. Steve Clarke is looking to get the feel good factor back after a poor Nations League campaign. The Celtic No.1 starts in goals but there are two notable inclusions in the Danish squad. Kasper Dolberg Read More

arts.ttl: Denmark v Scotland, Isak in action for Sweden and more: 2026 World Cup qualifiers - clockwatch
arts.sum: Scotland travel to Denmark in World Cup qualifier action All the goals as they go in | Email Barry Scotland: It’s no great surprise that Steve Clarke has made seven changes to the experimental side that hammered Liechtenstein in a friendly in June. Rarely one to inspire huge confidence while playing for his country, Angus Gunn is back in goal in place of the injured first choice Craig Gordon, while it’s great to see Brentford’s Aaron Hickey back in defence after a near two-year absence with various injury issues. John Souttar and Grant Hanley also come into the back four. In midfield, Scott McTominay and Ryan Christie are in for Billy Gilmour and Lennon Miller, while Lyndon Dykes will play as a lone striker in front of Che Adams. Ipswich Town’s George Hirst has to make do with a place in the bench but is likely to see some action. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Denmark vs Scotland LIVE as Steve Clarke wrestles with selection dilemmas
arts.sum: Steve Clarke's men kick off their Group C campaign in Copenhaen and will be looking to get off to a flyer in their bid to reach next summer's tournament
